body.name: POLKRANE Montessori Toddler Busy Board - Montessori Toys for 1+ Year Old, Toddler Busy Board, Baby Sensory Toys with Led Light Switch, Kid Educational&Learning Toys, Travel Toy for Car/Airplane
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Sunday, February 18. Order within 21 hrs 27 mins
features: 【Safe Toddler Toys】The polkrane busy board with LED light is crafted from high-quality logs and water-based paint, without harmful ingredients. Each part of the Montessori busy board has been carefully designed, and the edges of the toy have been fully polished without sharp edges; it is durable and has no risk of falling off parts, suitable for children aged 1-3. This product is compatible with two AAA batteries (not included).

【Portable Travel Toys】Montessori Toys for 2 year old has designed an 11-inch three-color hand-held ribbon. Young children can carry the sensory board to any place they want to go. Toddler travel toys size is 4.3*6.3*1.2 inches. The compact design fits perfectly in the hands of young children. Its weight (7.6 pounds) makes this toy an ideal choice for long-distance travel, car rides, or flights keeping children entertained.

【Learning Sensory Toys】These light switch toys for toddlers can light up the lamp beads of different colors through the buttons, which can teach children to distinguish various colors and perceive the changes of colors. Furthermore, it is also autism sensory toys. By pressing the blue sound button, the educational toys will emit a pleasant bird song, allowing children to listen to the sounds of nature. By pressing the red button, the sensory toys for toddlers 1-3 will vibrate regularly.

【As Fun as Destination】The learning toys are designed with RGB three-color LED beads and various forms of electric switches, which can promote the development of hand-eye coordination in children. The knobs under the triangular glass lens in the toddler busy board can be combined at will to change various colors. Montessori toys exercise children's logical thinking abilities.

【Ideal Festival Gift】Are you still worrying about your children's holiday gifts? Check out our travel toys for toddlers 1-3! The well-designed appearance of the Montessori board not only allows children to enjoy a variety of sensory experiences, but the portable ribbon design can take the toy anywhere you want. Whether it's birthday, Halloween, Christmas, Thanksgiving, Children's Day, or Easter, this toddler toy can be the first choice gift for your child.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Simple but keeps my kid busy!
reviews.reviewText: I was looking for a car toy that would keep my son occupied while not annoying me while I drive. A lot of the musical toys become annoying when they're pressed over and over and over again. This worked perfectly! The toy is pretty sturdy, since it's made of wood. The switches and buttons feel like good quality. There is one item on the switchboard that makes noise, but it's a bird chirping, so I don't mind it. The only two drawbacks I've had so far are that it's a little heavy (if he throws it, I definitely hear it) and he leaves some of the switches on which would drain the battery if I don't turn them off. I would definitely purchase again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Glowing lights in handmade wooden package.
reviews.reviewText: Got this out of the box (installed batteries) and the kids took to it right away. Playing with the buttons to find out it vibrates or makes bird noises, switching the switches and turning on the different coloured lights. It's an excellent problem-solving toy for small children. Their inquisitive minds will wonder what happens when they touch all the buttons, and with this product, they actually are allowed to touch them.Toy does seem a little delicate. It can handle minor drops, such as the height of little hands to the floor, but I suspect anything from about table height might be iffy. The product is securely sealed, so if anything internally was knocked loose there would be no way to access it.Even with those minor concerns, I'm very happy with this purchase. Very creative product and great alternative to the kids staring at a screen.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for Young One
reviews.reviewText: My one year old grandson loves this. Holds his attention. His 6 year old sister likes it too. One of the functions didn't work consistently though which is why I marked it down a little.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Broken, but the kid loves it so we're stuck with it.
reviews.reviewText: Our 20-month-old loves lamp switches. My wife and I know this not because we let him play with light switches, but because we keep having to keep him away from them whenever we try and give him some extra run-around space in the house. I'd heard about toys like these and thought that if we gave him his own light switch to play with, that could distract him from the potentially dangerous stuff. This particular model offered by this particular manufacturer (POLKRANE) was the only one I could find which didn't have a lot of reviews complaining about parts falling out, so I went with this one.It looks and feels pretty sturdy, and the lights and switches seem pretty secure in their seats. As far as safety is concerned, I'm satisfied.But, only two of the three lights work. There's a lamp switch, a dial switch, and a push switch. The push switch and dial switch work just fine, but the lamp switch doesn't do anything. I'm not sure if the switch is bad or the bulb, or both, or if there's some kind of break in the circuit between the two, but regardless, it's broken. This was THE PART we were most excited for, so we immediately considered sending it back.But, the kid had already gotten hold of it and really, really loved it. Turns out he wasn't so much interested in turning our lamps on as much as he was in the clicking noise the switch makes. The switch on the toy still clicks, and he doesn't KNOW it's supposed to do more than that, so he's thrilled.Since he likes it so much my wife and I would feel like awful parents for taking it away, sending it back, and making him wait for a new one. He doesn't understand it's broken, he'd only know that mama and papa took his new favorite toy away for no reason. So, I guess we're stuck with it.This toy gets three stars for being safe, sturdy, and at least more than half-way functional, and a fourth star because our kid likes it so much and it is distracting him from more dangerous electricals. But I can't say we'll be buying another POLKRANE toy, not unless their quality control improves.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Smaller than expected
reviews.reviewText: Smaller than expected, I was expecting it to be more of a tablet size, but is more like an iPhone size. I guess it is good for little hands but wish it was a bit bigger!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I purchased the busy board as a gift for my friends one year old, but honestly had a hard time giving it away! The switches, lights and keys were so much fun to play with.the 1 year old’s five and three-year-old siblings love the board as well and had a great time playing with it.I hardly ever write Amazon reviews, but when I came back to the product page to buy another one for my 18 month, old nephew, I decided to leave one. Quality product!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars 16 month old likes it
reviews.reviewText: My 16 month old is obsessed with light switches, cords, and remotes so I thought a toy like this might be a hit with him. The first time he played with it, it lasted for about 30 minutes, which is probably a record for him and one toy; usually he gets bored after a few minutes with one toy. Unfortunately, the little peg on the plug already broke off after the first time playing with it and a day later, one of the light circuits seems to be faulty as it doesn't turn on consistently unless I jiggle the switch. For $30 I would have liked it to last a little longer without issues, but the concept is cool. I would recommend that they replace the plug with a key and lock instead as that might be a bit more durable, and that they screw on the back of the toy instead of gluing it on so that if a circuit breaks, we can open the back and replace it if we want to. Then the battery pack can go there as well and there's more room on the front for an additional mechanism instead of the yellow and black box that takes up so much space. Just my two cents!
